text: The 1967 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 85th year in Major League Baseball, their tenth year in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their eighth at Candlestick Park. The team finished in second place in the National League with a record of 91 wins and 71 losses, 10½ games behind the NL and World Series champion St. Louis Cardinals. == Offseason == * November 29, 1966: Hal Haydel was drafted by the Giants from the Chicago Cubs in the 1966 minor league draft.Hal Hayden at Baseball Reference * December 14, 1966: Len Gabrielson was traded by the Giants to the California Angels for Norm Siebern.Norm Siebern at Baseball Reference * January 28, 1967: Von Joshua was drafted by the Giants in the 1st round (17th pick) of the 1967 Major League Baseball draft, but did not sign.Von Joshua at Baseball Reference == Regular season == * July 14, 1967: Eddie Mathews of the Atlanta Braves hit the 500th home run of his career. He hit his milestone homer off future Hall of Famer Juan Marichal of the Giants.Eddie Mathews | The Baseball Page === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day starters === *Jesús Alou *Jim Davenport *Tom Haller *Jim Ray Hart *Ken Henderson *Hal Lanier *Juan Marichal *Willie Mays *Willie McCovey http://www.baseball- almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1967&t;=SFN === Notable transactions === * June 6, 1967: 1967 Major League Baseball draft **Dave Rader was drafted by the Giants in the 1st round (18th pick). Player signed June 14, 1967.Dave Rader at Baseball Reference **Don Carrithers was drafted by the Giants in the 3rd round.Don Carrithers at Baseball Reference **Gary Lavelle was drafted by the Giants in the 20th round.Gary Lavelle at Baseball Reference * June 22, 1967: Dick Groat was purchased by the Giants from the Philadelphia Phillies.Dick Groat at Baseball Reference * July 15, 1967: Norm Siebern was purchased from the Giants by the Boston Red Sox. === Roster === {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
